intro: Tephrosia hypargyrea, commonly known as silverleaf tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows up to 3 meters in height, characterized by its dense, silver-gray foliage. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom throughout the growing season. Its leaves are simple and alternate, with a rough texture and a distinct silvery sheen. Tephrosia hypargyrea is often found in moist, well-drained soils and is adapted to thrive in humid climates.
